process_details.description: The Authorize Service business process is responsible for authorizing specific services for members enrolled in care management programs. This process evaluates service requests against authorization criteria, medical necessity, and benefit coverage to determine if the requested service should be approved.
trigger_events: Receive service authorization request from provider.
Receive service request from case manager.
Automatic trigger based on treatment plan.
results: Service authorization decision (approved, denied, or pended).
process_steps: Validate member eligibility and active enrollment.
Validate provider credentials and network status.
Check for prior authorizations or duplicates.
Evaluate medical necessity based on clinical guidelines.
Determine if service meets authorization criteria.
If criteria not clearly met, route for medical review.
Record authorization details and decision rationale.
Send notifications to provider and member.
Update case management and utilization tracking systems.
shared_data: Member data store including eligibility and benefits
Provider data store including credentials and network status
Health Benefits data store including coverage rules
process_details.constraints: Authorization requirements and timeframes vary by state regulations, program type, and service category. Some services require prior authorization while others may be authorized post-service. Medical necessity criteria must align with evidence-based clinical guidelines.
failures: Service does not meet medical necessity criteria.
Member not eligible for requested service.
Provider not authorized to deliver service.
Service not covered under member's benefit plan.
performance_measures: Member and provider satisfaction with authorization process
